intro: Chamissoa aspera, commonly known as the rough chamissoa, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and conical flower heads that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, such as deserts and coastal areas. Chamissoa aspera is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its distinctive appearance.
